Comment: I can't remember the details - 1990 era - but Honda was found to send parts across the ocean a couple times to "wash" them. That was also reported in the auto press. That was right when Honda started their big push to expand production in the USA.  I was working for the automotive industry myself at the time and saw that happen as well. But it was Lee Iacocca who said it best... "Our parts are good enough for Rolls Royce and other premium European automakers but not good enough for Isuzu". American auto parts makers had a devil of a time selling to the Japanese mostly because of the keiretsu system.   I had a USA built Corolla back then, exceptional vehicle but many parts were 2-3 different versions depending on VIN etc. Not fun having to play parts detective.
